00042 NodeSet
00043 MappingFunction::sample_points( NodeSet higher_order ) const
00044 {
00045   higher_order.set_all_corner_nodes( element_topology() );
00046   return higher_order;
00047 }

00049 
00050 void
00051 MappingFunction::convert_connectivity_indices_impl( EntityTopology topo,
00052                                                int input_type,
00053                                                int output_type,
00054                                                size_t* index_list,
00055                                                unsigned num_indices,
00056                                                MsqError& err )
00057 {
00058   bool in_edges, in_faces, in_region, out_edges, out_faces, out_region;
00059   TopologyInfo::higher_order( topo, input_type, in_edges, in_faces, 
00060                               in_region, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00061   TopologyInfo::higher_order( topo, output_type, out_edges, out_faces, 
00062                               out_region, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00063 
00064     // We could probably use TopologyInfo to do this more forward-compatible,
00065     // but for efficiency assume the current ITAPS node ordering, where
00066     // all mid-edge nodes occur before mid-face nodes and the mid-region
00067     // node is always last.
00068     
00069     // If both have mid-region nodes and they don't have the same stuff 
00070     // preceeding the mid-region node, then we need to change that index.
00071   bool region_diff = in_region && out_region && (in_faces != out_faces || in_edges != out_edges);
00072     // If both have mid-face nodes and one has mid-edge nodes and the other
00073     // does not, then we need to change the face indices.
00074   bool face_diff = in_faces && out_faces && in_edges != out_edges;
00075     // if nothing to change, return
00076   if (!face_diff && !region_diff)
00077     return;
00078 
00079   const unsigned corners = TopologyInfo::corners(topo);
00080   const unsigned edges   = TopologyInfo::edges(topo);
00081   const unsigned faces   = TopologyInfo::faces(topo);
00082   const unsigned in_face_offset = in_edges ? corners+edges : corners;
00083   const unsigned in_regn_offset = in_faces ? in_face_offset+faces : in_face_offset;
00084   const unsigned out_face_offset = out_edges ? corners+edges : corners;
00085   const unsigned out_regn_offset = out_faces ? out_face_offset+faces : out_face_offset;
00086   
00087     // In the code below, assertions are used to validate the input
00088     // connectivity data as we assume it is an internal mesquite coding
00089     // error for it to be inconsistent.  True error checking is used
00090     // if the elements are incompatible (the index list for the input
00091     // type contains indices for which there is no correpsonding logical
00092     // node location in the connectivity list of the output element type)
00093     // because that indicates an invalid setup (the combination of element
00094     // type and slave nodes does not result in a reduced element that is
00095     // compatible with the mapping function.)  The latter should probably
00096     // have been caught by the mapping function, but to be safe we check
00097     // again here.
00098   
00099   for (size_t i = 0; i < num_indices; ++i) {
00100     if (index_list[i] < in_face_offset) { // corner or mid-edge node
00101       // nothing to change for these, but check that if it is a mid-edge
00102       // node that the other type also has edges
00103       if (index_list[i] >= corners && !out_edges) {
00104         MSQ_SETERR(err)("Incompatible nodes present.", MsqError::UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT );
00105         return;
00106       }
00107     }
00108     else if (index_list[i] < in_regn_offset) { // mid-face node
00109       assert( TopologyInfo::dimension(topo) == 3 || index_list[i] == (unsigned)input_type - 1 );
00110       if (!out_faces) {
00111         MSQ_SETERR(err)("Incompatible nodes present.", MsqError::UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT );
00112         return;
00113       }
00114         // working with unsigned type (size_t), so make sure we express this
00115         // such that there are no intermediate negative values.
00116       index_list[i] = index_list[i] + out_face_offset - in_face_offset;
00117     }
00118     else { // region
00119       assert( in_region );
00120       assert( TopologyInfo::dimension(topo) == 3 && index_list[i] == (unsigned)input_type - 1 );
00121       if (!out_region) {
00122         MSQ_SETERR(err)("Incompatible nodes present.", MsqError::UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT );
00123         return;
00124       }
00125         // working with unsigned type (size_t), so make sure we express this
00126         // such that there are no intermediate negative values.
00127      index_list[i] = index_list[i] + out_regn_offset - in_regn_offset;
00128     }
00129   }
00130 }
00131 
00132 void MappingFunction2D::jacobian( const PatchData& pd,
00133                                   size_t element_number,
00134                                   NodeSet nodeset,
00135                                   Sample location,
00136                                   size_t* vertex_patch_indices_out,
00137                                   MsqVector<2>* d_coeff_d_xi_out,
00138                                   size_t& num_vtx_out,
00139                                   MsqMatrix<3,2>& jacobian_out,
00140                                   MsqError& err ) const
00141 {
00142   const MsqMeshEntity& elem = pd.element_by_index( element_number );
00143   const size_t* conn = elem.get_vertex_index_array();
00144   
00145   derivatives( location, nodeset, vertex_patch_indices_out,
00146                d_coeff_d_xi_out, num_vtx_out, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00147  
00148   convert_connectivity_indices( elem.node_count(), vertex_patch_indices_out, 
00149                                 num_vtx_out, err );  MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00150  
00151   jacobian_out.zero();
00152   size_t w = 0;
00153   for (size_t r = 0; r < num_vtx_out; ++r) {
00154     size_t i = conn[vertex_patch_indices_out[r]];
00155     MsqMatrix<3,1> coords( pd.vertex_by_index( i ).to_array() );
00156     jacobian_out += coords * transpose(d_coeff_d_xi_out[r]);
00157     if (i < pd.num_free_vertices()) {
00158       vertex_patch_indices_out[w] = i;
00159       d_coeff_d_xi_out[w] = d_coeff_d_xi_out[r];
00160       ++w;
00161     }
00162   }
00163   num_vtx_out = w;
00164 }
00165 
00166 void MappingFunction2D::ideal( Sample location,
00167                                MsqMatrix<3,2>& J,
00168                                MsqError& err ) const
00169 {
00170   const Vector3D* coords = unit_element( element_topology(), true );
00171   if (!coords) {
00172     MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT);
00173     return;
00174   }
00175   
00176   const unsigned MAX_VERTS = 4;
00177   MsqVector<2> d_coeff_d_xi[MAX_VERTS];
00178   size_t indices[MAX_VERTS], num_vtx = 0;
00179   derivatives( location, NodeSet(), indices,
00180                d_coeff_d_xi, num_vtx, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00181   assert(num_vtx > 0 && num_vtx <= MAX_VERTS);
00182   
00183   J.zero();
00184   for (size_t r = 0; r < num_vtx; ++r) {
00185     MsqMatrix<3,1> c( coords[indices[r]].to_array() );
00186     J += c * transpose(d_coeff_d_xi[r]);
00187   }
00188   
00189   double size = sqrt(sqrt(fabs(det(transpose(J) * J))));
00190   assert(size > -1e-15); // no negative jacobians for ideal elements!
00191   divide( 1.0, size, size );
00192   J *= size;
00193 }
00194 
00195 void MappingFunction3D::jacobian( const PatchData& pd,
00196                                   size_t element_number,
00197                                   NodeSet nodeset,
00198                                   Sample location,
00199                                   size_t* vertex_patch_indices_out,
00200                                   MsqVector<3>* d_coeff_d_xi_out,
00201                                   size_t& num_vtx_out,
00202                                   MsqMatrix<3,3>& jacobian_out,
00203                                   MsqError& err ) const
00204 {
00205   const MsqMeshEntity& elem = pd.element_by_index( element_number );
00206   const size_t* conn = elem.get_vertex_index_array();
00207   
00208   derivatives( location, nodeset, vertex_patch_indices_out,
00209                d_coeff_d_xi_out, num_vtx_out, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00210  
00211   convert_connectivity_indices( elem.node_count(), vertex_patch_indices_out, 
00212                                 num_vtx_out, err );  MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00213  
00214   jacobian_out.zero();
00215   size_t w = 0;
00216   for (size_t r = 0; r < num_vtx_out; ++r) {
00217     size_t i = conn[vertex_patch_indices_out[r]];
00218     MsqMatrix<3,1> coords( pd.vertex_by_index( i ).to_array() );
00219     jacobian_out += coords * transpose(d_coeff_d_xi_out[r]);
00220     if (i < pd.num_free_vertices()) {
00221       vertex_patch_indices_out[w] = i;
00222       d_coeff_d_xi_out[w] = d_coeff_d_xi_out[r];
00223       ++w;
00224     }
00225   }
00226   num_vtx_out = w;
00227 }

00229 
00230 void MappingFunction3D::ideal( Sample location,
00231                                MsqMatrix<3,3>& J,
00232                                MsqError& err ) const
00233 {
00234   const Vector3D* coords = unit_element( element_topology(), true );
00235   if (!coords) {
00236      MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT);
00237      return;
00238   }
00239 
00240   const unsigned MAX_VERTS = 8;
00241   MsqVector<3> d_coeff_d_xi[MAX_VERTS];
00242   size_t indices[MAX_VERTS], num_vtx = 0;
00243   derivatives( location, NodeSet(), indices,
00244                d_coeff_d_xi, num_vtx, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00245   assert(num_vtx > 0 && num_vtx <= MAX_VERTS);
00246   
00247   J.zero();
00248   for (size_t r = 0; r < num_vtx; ++r) {
00249     MsqMatrix<3,1> c( coords[indices[r]].to_array() );
00250     J += c * transpose(d_coeff_d_xi[r]);
00251   }
00252   
00253   double size = Mesquite::cbrt(fabs(det(J)));
00254   assert(size > -1e-15); // no negative jacobians for ideal elements!
00255   divide( 1.0, size, size );
00256   J *= size;
00257 }
